Comment: A message is a recording of the information exchanged between two agents. [The World Avatar]

Communicative act describes a function or an action represented by the message. This term is defined by FIPA-ACL (SC00037) based on speech act theory which defines the functions of simply specified actions. For more information, please visit: http://www.fipa.org/specs/fipa00037/SC00037J.html [The World Avatar]
Request is the action that the sender requests the receiver to perform some actions. [The World Avatar]
Agree is the action of agreeing to perform some actions, but it does not guarantee when to perform. [The World Avatar]
Inform is the action that the sender informs the receiver that a given job request is done, likely also the results of that job request. [The World Avatar]
Content is the actual information exchanged between the agents in a message. The receiving agent is responsible for understanding and processing the message content. [The World Avatar]
The status indicates the state of a message. [The World Avatar]
Closed is the status that the message is already replied to and no longer active. [The World Avatar]
Waiting for response is the status that the receiver of the message has not yet responded to the message. [The World Avatar]
A relation between a message and its targeting agent. [The World Avatar]
A relation between a message and the agent that created the message. [The World Avatar]
A relation between two messages that the later message follows up to the previous message. [The World Avatar]
A relation between a message and the communicative act used to classify the message. [The World Avatar]
A relation between a message and its actual content. [The World Avatar]
A relation between a message and its historical status. [The World Avatar]
A relation between message content and the known facts in the knowledge graph. The range of this object property usually is a list of instances in the ABoxes of ontologies. [The World Avatar]
A relation between message content and the desired output of the message request. The range of this object property usually is a list of concepts in the TBoxes of ontologies. [The World Avatar]
An attribute that indicates the time when the message was created or when the status of a message is updated. [The World Avatar]
